meanings.definition: To be extremely and uncritically fond of
meanings.sent1: She doted on her pet cat, giving it treats and cuddles all day.
meanings.sent2: The grandmother doted on her grandchildren, showering them with love and attention.
meanings.sent3: The little girl doted on her teddy bear, carrying it everywhere she went.
meanings.sent4: He doted on his vintage car, spending hours polishing it to perfection.
meanings.sent5: The elderly couple doted on each other, holding hands and sharing sweet moments together.

meanings.definition: To show excessive love or fondness for
meanings.sent1: The mother doted on her newborn baby, kissing and hugging him constantly.
meanings.sent2: The dog doted on its owner, wagging its tail and seeking affection.
meanings.sent3: The little boy doted on his favorite toy, carrying it around everywhere.
meanings.sent4: She doted on her garden, tending to each plant with care and attention.
meanings.sent5: The artist doted on his masterpiece, admiring it with pride and joy.

meanings.sent1: He doted on the scammer's promises, believing every word without question.
meanings.sent2: The old man doted on the fake fortune teller, following her advice blindly.
meanings.sent3: The gullible tourist doted on the con artist, falling for every trick.
meanings.sent4: She doted on the misleading advertisements, buying unnecessary products impulsively.
meanings.sent5: The naive student doted on the false rumors, spreading misinformation unknowingly.
